column1: 3;8037402013;"sototallycarl";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/reviews/id20717760";"5.3.8";3;"It’s fine";"There is a lot to love over the competition (HomeKit
column2: cheaper fees
column3: lots of different sensors) but just as much I don’t like. The over all product experience is surpassingly rough for a 4+ year old company.

column1: For example adding a bunch of sensors at once
column2: every 5th one seems to make the app hang and leave the sensor in limbo. Force quite
column3: re-open
column4: remove sensor
column5: force quite so it’s internal cache doesn’t get confused
column6: re-add. That’s dumb.

column1: The industrial design is basic. Just barely passable compared to pretty much everyone but old school SimpliSafe or hardwired ADT. If you can do the embedded or slim sensors
column2: I’d go that route. The sounds it makes are also unpleasant and the integrations to make custom sounds are so slow you might as well not have them. People have been asking for good sound for literally years and nothing changes…

column1: Performance is also meh. Supposedly can cover large houses but I have some sensors that trigger open but never trigger back to closed. Move closer and it works just fine. Rapidly open and closing a door often SKIPS an alert. It’s conceivable that such a lag is a security concern. HomeKit support is top notch
column2: it’s as fast and as accurate as the underlying Abode bridge.

column1: At the end of the day I wish I would have stuck with SimpliSafe. It’s more expensive and has no official HomeKit support
column2: but at least it’s a rock solid and nicely designed system.";"2021-11-18T08:18:59-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=828260682&type=Purple%20Software";"828260682";248;"en";"POSITIVE"

column2: app is under developed";"The Abode system itself has been working just as expected. I haven't had any issues with the sensors
column3: and the ability to have a cellular backup in the case of a power outage far outweighs the struggles of the growing brand.

column1: The app and the user interface of the system is complex and confusing so it takes awhile to learn.
1- The arm and disarm functions in the app is a very tiny icon in the upper corner. Easy to overlook and hard to access.
2- There is no way to set off the alarm in the case of an emergency. For example
column2: if someone breaks through your window while you are home and you don't have the glass break sensors on that window
column3: you'd have to arm your system and then go set off one of your sensors to make the alarm go off. They do have a way to set a button on your keyfob to a panic button
column4: but you run into the same issue. If you are unable to reach your keyfob
column5: or if you aren't even home but can see someone lurking around outside the house through a camera
column6: you're out of luck. The only work around is creating a ""action"" where you can click the button on your app and it can be set to send a specific message to an emergency contact
column7: or you personally can call the police. But most people have a DIY alarm system to scare off intruders
column8: so the alarm itself does the grunt work.

column1: 3- As other users have mentioned
column2: the app itself has a lot of buttons that give you a pop up to ""go to the browser"" and no actual app functionality. Then the browser on a smaller screen is just as useless. They have buttons on the far edge of lines that you can't see from a phone
column3: so you are forced to use a tablet or computer.

column1: 4- It would be a huge benefit to have a larger selection of arm modes similar to how ismartalarm has set it up. I usually prefer to have an Away (everything armed with delayed entry)
column2: Home (back door unarmed to let dogs in and out)
column3: Sleep (immediately alarms)
column4: Maintenance (notification if someone enters but no alarm)
column5: and a Standby. Right now Abode only gives you 3 options which can be customized to your preference ""standby""
column6: ""home""

column1: 5- This may be more my fault than Abode
column2: but I still haven't figured out how to make Abode call me if the alarm is triggered. I know you can do it through the IFTTT
column3: but testing it hasn't been successful yet. **update** you can set it up the IFTTT and it works just as expected!

column1: 6- If you exit the app screen it automatically locks you out. I have my phone fingerprint protected so the only one able to access the app is me. It would be helpful to choose how long you'd stay logged in. **update** to fix this you can disable Touch ID in the settings. Then you will no longer have to login each time you re-enter the app.
7- Automations are wonderful. I haven't experienced any downfall or issues with them
column2: other than you can't edit them in the app (see line item 3). **update** the location services drained my batter (like abode alone used of 44%) so some automations are a battery killer.

column1: 8- No way to give feedback to the developers of the app. **update** you can email support center and they can forward to the developers.
Overall I would still recommend Abode. It is a great system that I think will only get better. Hopefully some of the functionalities
column2: like the panic button in the app
column3: that are standard in other systems will will be added in soon. **update** I'm still very happy with my purchase!";"2017-08-16T20:10:32-07:00";"https://itunes.apple.com/us/review?id=828260682&type=Purple%20Software";"828260682";644;"en";"NEGATIVE"
